const IPDR_OID IPDR_ZeroOID

Detailed Description

The IPDR transmitter (client) library can be integrated with an external SNMP Agent, in order to support configuration and monitoring through an SNMP based management system.

See also IPDR configuration and monitoring data (MIB) and IPDR_ParametersHandlerFunc.

sessionTable
a read only table containing information about each configured session and statistics concerning records transfer through this session (total number of records, average rate at which records were sent by the application and number of lost records).

serversTable
a read only table containing information about each configured collector (server) along with its corresponding session id. In addition the table contains statistical information about the total number of transmitted records, number of acknowledged records, the average rate of transmission and the average rate of acknowledged records.

templatesTable
a read only table containing information about each template (template id and description).

keysTable
a read only table containing information about each configured key and Its associated template id.

keysAttributesTable
a read only table containing information about the key attributes (i.e. whether a key is enabled or disabled). The table indicates the attributes associated with every key for every configured session.

configuration
read/write table containing transmitter (client) configuration parameters. The table contains the parameters described in the IPDR_InitExporter function description as well as parameters controlling the log address and logging level of various components within the transmitter (client). Note that modifying parameters in this section might result in network connections being restarted (for example modifying the transmitter (client) port number or the console port number). The initial values for these parameters are set by the ParamsHandler callback to IPDR_InitExporter() (see also IPDR_ParametersHandlerFunc); then values can be overriden with the LoadMIB callback to IPDR_InitExporter() --- this also allows settin up initial sessions and collectors (servers) (presumably from values saved using the SaveMIB callback, which would have been created by "walking" the MIB tree with IPDR_MIBGetNext()).

commands
a section allowing the user to send commands for adding / removing sessions and adding / removing collectors (servers). Each command has a corresponding sub section containing the command's parameters and an execute parameter. In order to invoke a command, the user should fill the parameters and set the corresponding 'execute' parameter to 1.

Define Documentation

#define IPDR_MAX_OID_SIZE   6
 

The maximum number of integers in a IPDR_OID.

#define IPDR_MIB_ROOT_NODE_NAME   "iso.org.dod.internet.private.ipdr.exporter"
 

The root node name for all IPDR MIB items; it has the same meaning as #IPDR_MIB_ROOT_OID.

#define IPDR_MIB_ROOT_OID_LENGTH   7
 

The root OID's number of dotted items (see IPDR_MIB_ROOT_OID_INTS).

04004         IPDR_Status Status = IPDR_OK;
04005         Exporter *E = ExporterHandle ;
04006         if(! E || !Name || !Value || ! valueLen)
04007                 return IPDR_ERR ;
04008                 
04009         {
04010                 char *Name1, *Value1, *DefValue1;
04011                 Status = ParametersHandler_GetFirstParamName(Index, &Name1, &Value1, &DefValue1);

IPDR_API IPDR_GetServerStatisticsAndState (  IPDR_ExporterHandle  ExporterHandle,
IPDR_SessionHandle  SessionHandle,
IPDR_IPAddress  Addr,
unsigned short  Port,
IPDR_Time *  Now,
IPDR_Statistics *  Statistics,
IPDR_EventData *  LastEvent
) 
  

02187 {
02188     Exporter *E = ExporterHandle;
02189     Session *S = SessionHandle;
02190     int Index;
02191     static const IPDR_Statistics zeroStats = { 0, 0, 0, 0 };
02192     if (Statistics) { *Statistics = zeroStats; }
02193     if (Now) { * Now = 0; }
02194     if (LastEvent)
02195         { /* Set a default value in case we don't have a current server (collector) */
02196         EventDataInit(LastEvent, IPDR_EVENT_SERVER_DISCONNECTED, NULL, NULL, NULL);
02197         LastEvent->Extra.Disconnected.Reason = IPDR_EVENT_DISCONNECTED_INITIAL;
02198     }
02199     if (! E || ! S)
02200         {
02201         return IPDR_ERR_INVALID_VALUE;
02202     }
02203     Platform_Lock(EXPORTER_PLATFORM);
02204         
02205     if (Now)
02206         {
02207         Platform_GetTime(EXPORTER_PLATFORM, Now);
02208     }
02209 
02210     for (Index = 0; Index < S->CollectorSessions.Length; Index++)
02211         {
02212         CollectorSession *CS = (CollectorSession *) S->CollectorSessions.Data[Index];
02213                 if(CS != NULL && CS->Collector != NULL)
02214                 {
02215                         Collector *C = CS->Collector;
02216                         
02217                         if (C->Addr == Addr && C->Port == Port)
02218                         {
02219                                 if (Statistics) {
02220                                         *Statistics = CS->Statistics;
02221                                 }
02222                                 if (LastEvent) {
02223                                         *LastEvent = CS->LastEvent;
02224                                 }
02225                                 Platform_Unlock(EXPORTER_PLATFORM);
02226                                 return IPDR_OK;
02227                         }
02228                 }
02229     }
02230     Platform_Unlock(EXPORTER_PLATFORM);
02231     StatisticsInitialize(EXPORTER_PLATFORM, NULL, NULL, Statistics); /* zero return value */
02232     return IPDR_ERR_COLLECTOR_NOT_FOUND;
02233 }

IPDR_API_LINKAGE int IPDR_MIBVersion (  IPDR_ExporterHandle  ExporterHandle  ) 
 

Get the MIB version identifier (for synchronizing store and load).

Parameters:
ExporterHandle Handle to a transmitter (client) previously created by IPDR_InitExporter().
Returns:
Version (as passed to IPDR_LoadMIBFunc and IPDR_SaveMIBFunc); -1 is returned if there was an error (e.g., invalid Exporter). 
03973 {
03974     return 3;
03975 }

const char *  Name,
const char *  Value,
int  valueLen
) 
  

03982 {
03983         Exporter *E = ExporterHandle ;
03984         if(! E || !Name || !Value || ! valueLen)
03985                 return IPDR_ERR ;
03986                 
03987         {
03988                 const char* p = ParametersHandler_GetStringParam(& (E->ParamsHandler), Name);
03989                 if(p)
03990                 {
03991                         strncpy((char *)Value, p, valueLen);
03992                 }
03993         }
03994         return IPDR_OK ;
03995 }

IPDR_API IPDR_ParamSet (  IPDR_ExporterHandle  ExporterHandle,
const char *  Name,
const char *  Value
) 
  

04054 {
04055         Exporter *E = ExporterHandle ;
04056         if(! E || !Name || !Value)
04057                 return IPDR_ERR ;
04058                 
04059         return ParametersHandler_SetStringParam(& (E->ParamsHandler), Name, Value);
04060 }

Variable Documentation

const IPDR_OID IPDR_ZeroOID
 

The "zero" OID for starting a "walk" of the MIB (e.g., with IPDR_MIBGetNext()).
